fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Budget, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Communication, Migration and asylum
inter_groups: We consult our Social Security and Labour Ministry about Youth Politics and EU Youth programmes (such as EU Structured Dialogue, EU Youth Strategy, EU Solidarity corps and etc.)
eu_initiatives: EU Structured Dialogue, EU Youth Strategy, Eurodesk, ERYICA, European Youth Forum, EU Solidarity Corps.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
Knowledge-based representation of youth and youth organizations. 
Member capacity building and consolidation for the implementation of aims relevant to youth and the state. 
Youth work mainstreaming and providing information for youth. 
LiJOT development. 
Structure: LiJOT Assembly is the supreme governing authority of LiJOT. All organizations interested in LiJOT activities can take part in LiJOT Assembly yet only members of LiJOT have the right to vote. LiJOT President and LiJOT Board are elected during the Assembly and lead the everyday work of the organization. The Board under the President’s proposal constructs the executive body – LiJOT Bureau. 
 
Main projects:  
1. "Man ne dzin" ("I do care") - social networks campaign about elections for Lithuanian youth. (https://www.facebook.com/mannedzin/) 
2. "Šimtmečio dovanos" ("Century gifts") - social campaign for Lithuanian society. The main goal of this project is to collect and register gifts from society to Lithuania. This project is being implemented by the support of our Government. (http://www.lietuva.lt/100/lt/simtmecio-dovanos/apie) 
3. "Ačiū Lietuva" ("Thank you Lithuania") - attribute campaign for Lithuanian society. We created notebooks and bracelets that people bought in Lithuanian supermarkets or Online shops. (http://aciulietuva.lt) 
4. "Įsitrauk!" ("Get involved!") - EU Structured dialogue project involving young people into a dialogue between them and authorities in European and national level. (https://www.isitrauk.lt/) 
LiJOT General Assemblies - these events are being held annually (spring and autumn). 
LiJOT Leader's Club - these events are being held three / four times in a year. It invites people from our member organizations to discuss youth politics, youth work and other questions that are relevant for us at that time. 
Other LiJOT events: Gala dinner, LiJOT forums (summer festival and winter forum).
goals__remit: LiJOT seeks favourable changes for young people by serving as a platform for dialogue, Lithuanian youth organization interests and initiatives. LiJOT as the main partner for society, authorities, business and educational institutions in order to empower young people in the creation of their own and state welfare. The foundation of LiJOT work is the legitimate representation of identified interests based on the principles of mature democracy. Consolidated opinion and member organization interests define the priorities and the work of the organization. While running the organization the President, Board, Bureau, and Control Commission of LiJOT follow the policies agreed within the membership.
